name: Choobio
summary: A progressive web app that gives you live arrivals boards for London Underground stations.

paragraphs.title: A web app for live tube arrivals
paragraphs.text: Unlike the physical boards on the platform, Choobio gives you arrivals far ahead of the next few minutes and it also helps you find a quiet train by calculating the interval between two tube trains.

paragraphs.title: Elixir
paragraphs.text: Choobio's backend service written in Elixir. It's an OTP app that uses lots of the baked-in advantages that Elixir/Erlang provides. The app is highly fault tolerant, with each station & line handled in its own supervised process that can fall over and be restarted elegantly.

paragraphs.title: React
paragraphs.text: The frontend of Choobio is a React app hosted on Amazon S3. The React app uses the material-ui library and follows Google's Material Design principles.

paragraphs.title: A Progressive Web App
paragraphs.text: Choobio is a Progressive Web App that has offline functionality using IndexedDB, Service Workers, App Manifests and more. On Android, it can be installed and used as if it were a native application.

name: Football Rumours
summary: An Amazon Echo skill to tell you the latest football transfer stories about your team

paragraphs.title: An echo skill to get football transfer rumours
paragraphs.text: You can ask this skill for rumours about your favourite football team, and it will find you stories from today's papers that match the team name you gave.

paragraphs.title: Written with modern Javascript
paragraphs.text: The skill is written in modern, modular, vanilla JS, making heavy use of async features like Promises. I used Test-Driven-Development and employ Mocha and Chai to test the code.

paragraphs.title: Hosted on AWS Lambda
paragraphs.text: The code is hosted as an AWS Lambda function. Under the covers it uses AWS DynamoDB as a store for the days' stories to ensure it only scrapes the web once per day.

name: TRX
summary: An innovative app for the buying and selling of TV rights around the world.

paragraphs.title: A B2B app for the TV industry
paragraphs.text: TRX was conceived by experienced TV execs who wanted to bring efficiency and simplicity to the world of TV licensing. Distributors and Broadcasters around the world can use TRX to negotiate and complete TV rights deals. Channel 4 and Sky in the UK are amongst the investors in TRX.

paragraphs.title: Designed to make deals easier
paragraphs.text: I was lucky enough to join TRX at the very beginning. During the initial phase of the project I assisted with research and scoping tasks. In 2016, I was made Product Manager and worked with the team to put together the initial beta release in late 2016.

paragraphs.title: User Experience
paragraphs.text: I see my main role as ensuring we deliver the right product for our users. TRX is a disruptive application aiming to change existing behaviours, and in order to succeed we have to ensure our User Experience is top notch.
